Unarmed Strike.Description: Just a punch or slap of the hand.
Special: Unarmed strikes are always considered light attacks and can be used with the weapon finesse feat.
Unarmed strikes do not count as natural weapons

Gauntlet.Description: A metal glove that lets you deal lethal damage with unarmed strikes. Medium and heavy armors (except breastplate) come with gauntlets.
Special: Your opponent cannot use a disarm action to disarm you of gauntlets.

Battle Aspergillum.Description: Named for the common aspergillum, a mace-like tool used by priests to sprinkle holy water, this light mace has a hollow head and a metal plug to fit the hollow’s neck.
Special: When the mace hits a creature, holy water sprinkles out; creatures subject to damage from holy water take 1 point of additional damage.
You must refill the aspergillum after 5 hits with a standard action that provokes an AoO.

Brass Knife.Description: Though brass doesn’t hold as sharp an edge as steel, it isn’t vulnerable to rust like steel is.
Special: Fragile

Brass Knuckles.Description: These close combat weapons are designed to fit comfortably around the knuckles, narrowing the contact area and therefore magnifying the amount of force delivered by a punch.
Special: You may hold an object in a hand wearing brass knucles, but you cannot weild a weapon.
You may cast a spell with somantic components with a concentration check (DC 10 + spell level).
Monk

Cestus.Description: The cestus is a glove of leather or thick cloth that covers the wielder from mid-finger to mid-forearm, ofen reinforced with metal plates over the fingers.
Special: You may wield or carry items while wearing a cestus, howeveer you take a -2 to all precision-based tasks involving that hand (such as opening locks).
Monk

Dagger.Description: A dagger has a blade that is about 1 foot in length.
Special: You get a +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand skill checks made to conceal a dagger on your body.

Punching Dagger.Description: A punching dagger’s blade is attached to a horizontal handle that projects out from the fist when held.

Spiked Gauntlet.Description: A glove made of metal with jagged spikes for extra damage, and the cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet.
Special: An attack with a spiked guantlet is considered an armed attack.
Attached

Traveling Kettle.Description: These small tea kettles are made with clamping lids and heavily reinforced handles.
Special: A traveling kettle with boiling water inside deals an additional 1 point of fire damage on a hit.
Boiling water cools to a non-damaging temperature after 5 minutes.
Monk

Hook Hand.Description: Pirates who lose a hand in the course of their adventures sometimes attach hooks to their wrists.
Special: It takes 1 minute to attach or detach a hook hnad.
Attached
Disarm

Kunai.Description: Crafted from a single piece of iron, a kunai has a leaf-shaped blade and a ring for a pommel.
Special: A kunai can readily substitute for a crowbar or piton without being damaged in the process.

Light Mace.Description: A light mace is made up of an ornate metal head attached to a simple wooden or metal shaft.

Sickle.Description: A curved blade extends from the basic wooden handle, though usable in a pinch the sickle is mainly a farming tool.
Special: Trip

Spring Blade.Description: This 4-inch blade is attached via a hinge to a wooden handle with a slot in the center, into which the blade can be folded.
Special: You gain a +4 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks to conceal a spring blade on your body, and noticing the hidden blade requiers a DC 20 Perception check.
Releasing the blade is a free action, and resetting it is a move action.

Wodden Stake.Description: This close combat weapon is just a sharpened piece of wood. Iron spikes used as weapons deal damage as wooden stakes.

Club.Description: This weapon is usually just a shaped piece of wood, sometimes with a few nails or studs embedded in it.

Mere Club.Description: Traditionally made of carved stone, the mere (MEH-reh) is a short, flat-sided, sharp-pointed club.
Special: Fragile

Heavy Mace.Description: A heavy mace has a larger head and a longer handle than a normal (light) mace.

Morningstar.Description: A morningstar is a spiked metal ball, affixed to the top of a long handle.

Shortspear.Description: A shortspear is about 3 feet in length, making it a suitable thrown weapon.

Bayonet.Description: Bayonets are close combat weapons designed to fit into the grooves or muzzles of crossbows and firearms.
Special: Bayonets allow you to make melee attacks with these weapons but render them temporarily useless as ranged weapons.
Attaching or removing a bayonet is a move action.

Boarding Pike.Description: A boarding pike is an 8-foot-long pole topped with a foot-long tapered metal tip.
Special: Brace
Reach

Kumade.Description: Adapted from a garden rake, the kumade consists of a wood or bamboo pole topped with a metal claw.
Special: When a kumade is secured to a surface, such as a rafter or window sill, its handle can be climbed as a 5-foot length of rope.
Grapple

Collapsible Kumade.Description: This weapon acts as a kumade, but the handle consists of bamboo sections held together by a taut rope running through the center.
Special: When a kumade is secured to a surface, such as a rafter or window sill, its handle can be climbed as a 5-foot length of rope.
Releasing the rope is a standard action that provokes attacks of opportunity and causes the weapon to collapse into a bundle that fits into a backpack.
Reassembling the collapsible kumade requires a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity.
Grapple

Lantern Staff.Description: This long metal staff has reservoirs for lamp oil, and a lantern-like structure at its head.
Special: The lantern staff is fuelled as and provides light as a hooded lantern.
While lit, attacks with the lantern staff deal 1 point of fire damage in addition to the normal damage.

Longspear.Description: A longspear is about 8 feet in length.
Special: Brace
Reach

Quarterstaff.Description: A quarterstaff is a simple piece of wood, about 5 feet in length.
Special: Double
Monk

Spear.Description: A spear is 5 feet in length and can be thrown.
Special: Brace

Boar Spear.Description: This spear with a spiraling blade has a metal crossbar approximately halfway down its length.
Special: Brace
If you ready a boar spear against a charge and your attack hits, you get a +2 shield bonus to your AC against that creature until your next turn.

Weighted Spear.Description: This pole has a spear head at one end and a mace head at the other.
Special: A weighted spear can be used as a regular spear, or as a double weapon, with the mace head dealing bludgeoning damage and only x2 on a crit.
Brace
Double

Blowgun.Description: Blowguns are generally used to deliver debilitating (but rarely fatal) poisons from a distance. They are nearly silent when fired.

Heavy Crossbow.Description: You draw a Heavy Crossbow back by turning a small winch.
Special: Loading a heavy crossbow is a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity, using two hands.
You may shoot a havy crossbow with one hand at a -4 on attack rolls
You can choost a heavy crossbow with each hand, teating them as one-handed weapons (the -4 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).

Heavy Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.
Special: When fired underwater, the crossbow has a range increment of 20 feet.

Light Crossbow.Description: You draw a Light Crossbow back by pulling a lever.
Special: Loading a light crossbow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity, using two hands.
You may shoot a light crossbow with one hand at a -2 on attack rolls
You can choost a light crossbow with each hand, teating them as light weapons (the -2 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).

Light Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.
Special: When fired underwater, the crossbow has a range increment of 20 feet.

Sling.Description: A sling is little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of strings.
Special: Your Strength modifier applies to damage rolls when you use a sling, just as it does for thrown weapons.
Loading a sling is a move action that requires two hands and provokes attacks of opportunity.
You can fire, but not load, a sling with one hand.
You may fire ordinary stones with a sling at a -1 to attack rolls and dealing damage as 1 size smaller.

Stingchuck.Description: A stingchuck is a foul bag made of a humanoid’s head with the brain removed and the skull heavily scored so that it bursts open when thrown.
Special: A sucessful hit releases the contens, dealing 1d6 damage and forcing a DC 11 Fortitude save to avoid being nauseated for 1d3 rounds.
Each round a creature remains nauseated by a stingchuck, it takes 1 additional point of damage from the biting vermin.
All creatures within the splash effect take 1 point of damage from the vermin but do not risk being nauseated.

Stonebow.Description: A stonebow, or bullet crossbow, resembles a light crossbow except for the distinct U-shaped bend in the stock to fire sling bullets.
Special: Loading a stonebow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity, requiring two hands.
You may shoot a stonebow with one hand at a -2 on attack rolls.
You can choost a stonebow with each hand, teating them as light weapons (the -2 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).
You may fire ordinary stones with a sling at a -1 to attack rolls and dealing damage as 1 size smaller.

Throwing Darts.Description: Darts are missile weapons, designed to fly such that a sharp, often weighted point will strike first.

Crossbow Bolts.Description: These bolts come in a case or quiver that holds 10 bolts (or 5 for a repeating crossbow).
Special: The given weapon stats are for a single colt, and using it as a melee weapon.
When using the bolt as a melee weapon, treat it as a light improvised weapon, with a -4 to attack rolls.

Crossbow Bolts, Acid.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with acid.
Special: These bolts deal their additional acid damage on a sucessful hit.

Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison.Description: These bolts have a strange tip that delivers the poison, but also affects accuracy.
Special: Drow poison (DC 13 Fort)
Range penalties are doubled when using a drow poison bolt

Crossbow Bolts, Fire.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with a alchemical fire.
Special: These bolts deal their additional fire damage on a sucessful hit.

Javelin.Description: A javelin is a thin throwing spear.
Special: If used as a melee weapon, you are treated as non-proficient with it and take a –4 penalty on attack rolls.

Sling Bullets.Description: These bullets come in a leather pouch that holds 10 bullets.

Sling Bullets, Groaning.Description: These sling bullets are honeycombed with overlapping perforations that cause them to emit an eerie moan audible within 500 feet of their flight path.

Sling Bullets, Smoke.Description: Smoke bullets burst open when striking a target to release a gas that can nauseate nearby creatures.
Special: Smoke bullets require only a successful touch attack to release the smoke.
The target is nauseated for 2 rounds unless it passes a DC 13 Fortitude save.

Blowgun Darts.Description: These light darts have tiny grooves behind the tips.
Special: A character can apply poison to a blowgun dart without risk of poisoning himself.

Boarding Axe.Description: A boarding axe is similar to a handaxe, but features a spike that allows the weapon to do either slashing or piercing damage.
Special: A boarding axe grants a +2 circumstance bonus on Climb checks to scale wooden or other penetrable surfaces, such as ice.

Throwing Axe.Description: This is a small axe balanced for throwing.

Blade Boot.Description: Blade boots come with a spring-mounted knife that pops out when triggered with the right combination of toe presses.
Special: You can use the blade boot as an off-hand weapon.
Releasing the knife is a swift action and rearming it is a full-round action.
When the blade is extended, you treat normal terrain as difficult and difficult terrain as impassable.

Cat-o’-Nine-Tails.Description: This short whip is made of nine knotted thongs about 3 feet in length.
Special: Disarm
This flail deals no damage to any creature with an armor bonus of at least +1, or a natural armor bonus of at least +3.

Claw Blades.Description: Bought in a set of five, they fit over the wearer’s claws on one hand.
Special: These subtle blades can only be used by catfolk with the cat’s claws racial trait.
Caeth are always proficient with claw blades.
The blades grant a +1 enhancement bonus on claw attack rolls with the equiped hand, changing the weapon type from a natural attack to a light slashing weapon.

Dueling Dagger.Description: This dagger is used in the off hand to block attacks.
Special: When you fight defensively or use Combat Expertise while wielding a dueling dagger, your bonus to AC increases by 1.
If you aren’t proficient with a dueling dagger, you treat it as a dagger and gain no special benefits.

Dogslicer.Description: This short, curved sword is a favorite weapon of goblins, who show unusual cunning by drilling numerous holes in the blade to reduce the weapon’s weight.
Special: Fragile

Light Hammer.Description: A lighter version of a warhammer, this weapon usually has a sleek metal head with one striking surface.

Gladius.Description: The gladius is the favorite short sword of gladiators, with a heavier blade than the standard short sword.
Special: Feats and abilities that affect short swords apply to the gladius.
Performance

Handaxe.Description: This one-handed axe is short (roughly 1 foot long) and designed for use with one hand.

Tri-Bladed Katar.Description: Where most punching daggers boast a single thick blade, the tri-bladed katar features a fan of three splayed razor edges.
Special: Any effects that apply to a punching dagger also apply to a tri-bladed katar.
This knife can be designed to loke like another type of object (a DC 15 Perception check reveals the deception).
A switchblade is treated as a dagger, and can be activated as a free action if held.

Kobold Tail Attachment (Long Lash).Description: This slender cord has tiny bits of glass and stone embedded in its length.
Special: Donning a kobold tail attachment requires a full-round action.
Kobolds gain a +4 bonus to CMD vs disarm attempts to remove their tail attachment.
Reach

Kobold Tail Attachment (Pounder).Description: This squat ball is made from some sort of dull metal.
Special: Donning a kobold tail attachment requires a full-round action.
Kobolds gain a +4 bonus to CMD vs disarm attempts to remove their tail attachment.

Kobold Tail Attachment (Razored).Description: This metal wedge has a prickly edge on one of its sides.
Special: Donning a kobold tail attachment requires a full-round action.
Kobolds gain a +4 bonus to CMD vs disarm attempts to remove their tail attachment.

Kobold Tail Attachment (Spiked).Description: This narrow spike tapers to a sharp point.
Special: Donning a kobold tail attachment requires a full-round action.
Kobolds gain a +4 bonus to CMD vs disarm attempts to remove their tail attachment.

Kobold Tail Attachment (Sweeper).Description: When properly used, this sharply curved piece of metal can knock opponents off their feet.
Special: Donning a kobold tail attachment requires a full-round action.
Kobolds gain a +4 bonus to CMD vs disarm attempts to remove their tail attachment.
Unlike most trip weapons, you cannot drop it if you are tripped during your own trip attempt.
Trip

Kukri.Description: A kukri is a curved blade, about 1 foot in length.

Machete.Description: This tool is a wide, single-edged blade about 2 feet in length. Most often used to hack through dense vegetation, it works equally well as a weapon.
Special: A character proficient with a machete gains a +1 circumstance bonus on Survival checks to get along in the wild.

Light Pick.Description: This weapon, adapted from the pickaxe tool, has a head with a slightly curved, armorpiercing spike and a hammerlike counterweight.

Sap.Description: This weapon consists of a soft wrapping around a hard, dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. The head is wider than the handle and designed to spread out the force of the blow, making it less likely to draw blood or break bones.

Starknife.Description: From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend from this weapon like points on a compass rose.

Butterfly Sword.Description: These short matching swords come in pairs, cleverly nested together to appear as a single blade.
Special: You may draw both swords at the same time, and separate them as a free action
The listed price and weight is for a pair of butterfly swords and masterwrok versions cost 320 gp for the pair.
Magical enhancements must be added seperately, so a +1 to one of the two blades would cost an addition 4,000 gp.
Monk

Shortsword.Description: Short swords are some of the most common weapons found in any martial society, and thus designs are extremely varied, depending on the region and creator.

War Razor.Description: The war razor is nothing but an oversized flip knife or shaving razor.
Special: You gain a +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks made to conceal the weapon on your body.

Ankus.Description: Also known as an elephant goad, this tool consists of a 2- to 3-foot rod ending in a spearhead and a backward-facing hook.
Special: Disarm
Trip

Battleaxe.Description: The head of this axe may have one blade or two, and the handle is long enough that you can wield it one-handed or two-handed.

Combat Scabbard.Description: This combat scabbard has a sharp blade on the outer edge, allowing you to use it as a weapon.
Special: Improvised

Cutlass.Description: This short, curved sword is favored by seafarers for close-quarters combat.
Special: The cutlass is treated as a scimitar for any effects that apply to scimitars.

Light Flail.Description: A light flail consists of a weighted striking end connected to a handle by a sturdy chain.
Special: Disarm
Trip

Gandasa.Description: A gandasa is a wide, single-edged dagger on a 2-foot handle and is wielded in combat like an axe.

Longsword.Description: This sword is about 3½ feet in length.

Manopole.Description: This rigid, fingerless gauntlet has three blades projecting from the gauntlet’s hand.
Special: A manople takes a full-round action to don, and gives you a +10 bonus to your CMD against disarm attempts.
Blocking
Disarm

Heavy Pick.Description: This variant of the pick has a longer handle and can be used with one or two hands, making it a common weapon for mounted soldiers.

Special: You can’t wield a rapier in two hands in order to apply 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus to damage.
Finesse

Scimitar.Description: This curved sword is only sharp on the outer edge, and the back is flat, giving the blade a triangular cross-section.

Scizore.Description: The scizore is a hardened tube that fits over the forearm, ending in a semicircular blade.
Special: The scizore grants a +1 shield bonus to AC, but you lose that bonus if you attack with it.
You take a -1 to attack rolls made with a scizore.
A scizore provides a +10 bonus to your CMD against being disarmed of your scizore.
You may don a scizore with a full-round action, and you may not use a hand wearing one for anything else.

Sword Cane.Description: This slender light blade lies within a wooden container that serves as both its scabbard and hiding place.
Special: You can draw the blade from the cane as a swift action (or a free action with the Quick Draw feat).
An observer must make a DC 20 Perception check to realize an undrawn sword cane is a weapon rather than a walking stick (DC 10 if  observer is able to handle the weapon).
You can’t wield a sword cane in two hands in order to apply 1-1/2 times your Strength modifier to damage.
Finesse

Macuahuitl.Description: This Stone Age weapon, also called a terbutje, is made from a length of tempered wood with bits of shark teeth, obsidian, glass, or similar materials studded all along its length.
Special: Fragile
A machuahuitl may also be made of steel, this removes the fragile quality and increases the price to 20 gp and the weight to 4 lbs.

Trident.Description: A trident has three metal prongs at the end of a 4-foot-long shaft.

Warhammer.Description: This weapon consists of a wooden haft and a heavy, metal head with a haft long enough to wield it one- or two-handed.

Bardiche.Description: The crescent axe-blade of this polearm is attached to the haft at two points and extends past the top.
Special: You gain a +2 bonus to your CMD to resist sunder attempts made against a bardiche.
Brace
Reach

Bec De Corbin.Description: A polearm with both a blunt hammer head and a hooked spike, you primarily attack with the spike.
Special: You gain a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks to sunder medium or heavy armor with a bec de corbin.
Brace
Reach

Bill.Description: The blade of this polearm is a curved or hooked chopping blade with a spiked projection on the back of the blade.
Special: When fighting defensively or with total defense, this weapon gives you a +1 shield bonus to AC.
A mounted opponent hit by a bill takes a –1 penalty on his Ride check to stay mounted.
Brace
Disarm
Reach

Earth Breaker.Description: This massive hammer’s head ends in multiple blunt spikes that help concentrate the force of a powerful swing

Falchion.Description: This sword has one curved, sharp edge like a scimitar, with the back edge unsharpened and either flat or slightly curved.

Heavy Flail.Description: Similar to a light flail, a heavy flail has a larger metal ball and a longer handle.
Special: Disarm
Trip

Glaive.Description: A glaive is composed of a simple blade mounted on the end of a pole about 7 feet in length.
Special: Reach

Glaive-Guisarme.Description: This polearm combines the blade of a glaive with a wicked hook.
Special: A mounted opponent hit by a glaive-guisarme takes a –2 penalty on her Ride check to stay mounted.
Reach
Reach

Greataxe.Description: This heavy axe is usually 3 to 4 feet long, and may have one head or two. A greataxe may be 'bearded' to increase cleaving power and help pull down shields.

Greatclub.Description: This larger, bulkier version of the common club is heavy enough that you can’t wield it with one hand.

Greatsword.Description: This immense two-handed sword is about 5 feet in length. A greatsword may have a dulled lower blade that can be gripped.

Guisarmee.Description: A guisarme is an 8-foot-long shaft with a blade and a hook mounted at the tip.
Special: Reach
Trip

Halberd.Description: A halberd is similar to a 5-foot-long spear, but it also has a small, axe-like head mounted near the tip.
Special: Brace
Trip

Lucerne Hammer.Description: This polearm has both a pronged hammer head for crushing blows and a spiked head for piercing and peeling armor.
Special: You gain a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks to sunder medium or heavy armor with a lucerne hammer.
Brace
Reach

Horsechopper.Description: Crafted by goblins for battling horses, this weapon is essentially a long-handled halberd with an enlarged hook on the blade.
Special: Most horsechoppers are sized for Small creatures.
Reach
Trip

Lance.Description: A long weapon for thrusting, having a wooden shaft and a pointed steel head
Special: A lance deals double damage when used from the back of a charging mount; while mounted, you can wield a lance with one hand.
Reach

Ogre Hook.Description: This large crook of sharpened metal makes it easy to trip and catch fleeing opponents.
Special: Invented by ogres, most ogre hooks are Large and crudely fashioned—often from metal torn from previous victims’ weapons and armor.
Trip

Pickaxe.Description: A two-handed version of the heavy pick, the brutal pickaxe is equally effective at breaking up earth and stone as it is at sundering flesh and bone.

Planson.Description: This 5-foot tapered pole is bound in metal with a narrow metal spike projecting from the top.
Special: Brace

Ranseur.Description: Similar in appearance to a trident, a ranseur has a single spear at its tip, flanked by a pair of short, curving blades.
Special: Disarm
Reach

Scythe.Description: This weapon consists of a long wooden shaft with protruding handles and a sharp curved blade set at a right angle.
Special: Trip

Syringe Spear.Description: This spear has a comparment inside to store injectible liquids (poisons).
Special: A successful hit with the spear injects the liquid contents of the container (typically poison) into the target.
Refilling a syringe spear takes 1 minute.
The cost and wieght of armor spikes is added to the base armor
Adding spikes to your armor or shield allows you to deal extra damage on a successful grapple attack (-4 CMB if you are not proficient with martial weapons).
You can also make a standard melee attack (or off-hand attack) with the spikes, and they count as a light weapon in this case.
